wiki.occupation: Avenger (reservist), college student, protector of the Kamekeri
wiki.place_of_birth: The village of Kamekeri, Costa Verde
wiki.aliases: Daughter of the Volcano God, La Garra Argentada, La Garra Plata
wiki.relatives: Jaime Santiago (father, deceased), Peliali (mother, deceased), [[Jarvis, Edwin|Edwin Jarvis]] (American sponsor)
wiki.powers: Silverclaw can either partially or fully take the form and abilities of any jungle creature native to Costa Verde (possibly to all of South America), adopting a silver color in action. She has a mystical link to the lands and peoples of Costa Verde, though the limits of this connection are as yet unexplored.
wiki.paraphernalia: Silverclaw wears a ceremonial outfit made for her by her father.
wiki.bio_text: The Kamekeri are a small South American tribe located in Costa Verde. Originally part of the Tahuantinsuyu, they worshipped both the Incan and their own local gods until missionaries convinced them to reject their old beliefs for modern ways. However, Peliali, the Volcano Goddess, swore never to leave her home or her people. Though the Kamekeri kept in touch with the outside world the Costa Verde government officially learned of their existence only recently.
wiki.bio:
The Kamekeri are a small South American tribe located in Costa Verde. Originally part of the Tahuantinsuyu, they worshipped both the Incan and their own local gods until missionaries convinced them to reject their old beliefs for modern ways. However, Peliali, the Volcano Goddess, swore never to leave her home or her people. Though the Kamekeri kept in touch with the outside world the Costa Verde government officially learned of their existence only recently.


Years ago Jamie Santiago returned from one of many journeys into the Andes with an infant girl he claimed was his by Peliali. Revealed as a shape-shifter at her christening, Lupe grew up teased by other children. When her father died, Lupe was taken in by the Church orphanage, despite their misgivings about her “ungodly” powers. When a TV ad brought the orphanage a letter from Edwin Jarvis they decided to make Lupe his sponsor, believing that his connections to [[Iron Man (Anthony Stark)|Iron Man]] might be able to help her someday. Lupe began a correspondence with Jarvis that lasted several years, though not revealing her birthright. Agents of [[Magnum, Moses|Moses Magnum]] learned of her powers while traveling to America and forced her to fight the Avengers while they stole a seismic cannon being shipped through JFK Airport. Lupe cooperated on the condition that no hostages or bystanders were killed. Once Magnum Force escaped, Lupe, now called Silverclaw, helped the Avengers retrieve the cannon.

Lupe attended college classes until a telegram warned her of an old Costa Verde prophecy coming true. Once Silverclaw and the Avengers arrived they discovered that sorcerer [[Gath, Kulan|Kulan Gath]] had transformed the Kamekeri into Hyborian Era (circa 10, 000 B.C.) versions of themselves and was intending to sacrifice Peliali in order to attain godhood and destroy the [[Earth]]. The Avengers were able to distract Gath long enough for Silverclaw to channel the belief of the Kamekeri into Peliali allowing her to escape and leaving Gath to the mercy of his demonic masters.

Now an Avenger reservist, Silverclaw continued her studies while helping out against such foes as [[Ronan]] the Accuser, a homunculus of [[Diablo (Esteban De Ablo)|Estaban De Ablo]], and [[Kang]]. When the Avengers helped [[Mantis]] save her son [[Quoi|Sequoia]] from one of the [[Thanosi]] (renegade [[Thanos]] duplicates), Silverclaw was attracted to the extra-dimensional [[Haywire (Earth-712)|Haywire]], but his obsession with reviving his dead girlfriend [[Inertia (Earth-712)|Inertia]] ultimately destroyed him. Silverclaw also aided the Avengers when an extra-dimensional madman tried to merge their universe with his own and when an insane [[Scarlet Witch (Wanda Maximoff)|Scarlet Witch]] attempted to destroy the Avengers. Recently, Silverclaw was seen battling Ms. Marvel as an anti-registration combatant.
